data.neighbors.hubness.visualization

Class BasicDataHubnessVisualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.neighbors.hubness.visualization.BasicDataHubnessVisualizer

  • public class BasicDataHubnessVisualizer
extends java.lang.Object
    This script generates data with the designated level of noise, performs MDS and visualizes some properties of data hubness OR loads the data and visualizes the hubness properties of some real-world datasets.

      Initialization.

      Initialization.

      Generate the visualizations and save them to a file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This script performs some basic hubness visualization for synthetic Gaussian or loaded real-world data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicDataHubnessVisualizer

        public BasicDataHubnessVisualizer(int numClusters,
                          int numDimensions,
                          int numOriginalInstances,
                          int numNoisyInstances)
        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        numClusters - Integer that is the number of clusters.
        numDimensions - Integer that is the number of dimensions.
        numOriginalInstances - Integer that is the number of original non-noisy data instances to generate.
        numNoisyInstances - Integer that is the number of noisy instances to generate, by drawing them from a uniform distribution.

      • BasicDataHubnessVisualizer

        public BasicDataHubnessVisualizer(DataSet dset)
        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        dset - DataSet object to visualize.

    • Method Detail

      • generateAndPrintOutTo

        public void generateAndPrintOutTo(java.io.File outDir,
                         boolean useDiffColors,
                         boolean drawOnGrid)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate the visualizations and save them to a file.
        Parameters:
        outDir - Output directory.
        useDiffColors - Boolean flag indicating whether to use a multi-colored visualization scheme.
        drawOnGrid - Boolean flag indicating whether to draw on grid and make a density plot or to draw nodes instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • drawAverageGridHubness

        public void drawAverageGridHubness(float[][] pointXY,
                          int[] hubnessArray,
                          java.io.File outFile,
                          DataSet dset)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Draw the average data hubness on a grid, a density-plot.
        Parameters:
        pointXY - float[][] point coordinates determined by MDS.
        hubnessArray - int[] array of neighbor occurrence frequencies.
        outFile - File to save the results to.
        dset - DataSet object that the results refer to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • drawAndPersist

        public void drawAndPersist(float[][] pointXY,
                  int[] hubnessArray,
                  java.io.File outFile,
                  DataSet dset,
                  boolean useDiffColors)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs data visualization. In the multi-color mode, the points from different classes will be drawn in different colors.
        Parameters:
        pointXY - float[][] point coordinates determined by MDS.
        hubnessArray - int[] array of neighbor occurrence frequencies.
        outFile - File to save the results to.
        dset - DataSet object that the results refer to.
        useDiffColors - Boolean flag indicating whether to use a multi-colored visualization scheme.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • drawAndPersistGBH

        public void drawAndPersistGBH(float[][] pointXY,
                     int[] goodHubnessArray,
                     int[] badHubnessArray,
                     java.io.File outFile,
                     DataSet dset)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs data visualization. Good and bad hubness is taken into account to produce images where nodes are green if they are good hubs and red if they are bad hubs.
        Parameters:
        pointXY - float[][] point coordinates determined by MDS.
        hubnessArray - int[] array of neighbor occurrence frequencies.
        outFile - File to save the results to.
        dset - DataSet object that the results refer to.
        useDiffColors - Boolean flag indicating whether to use a multi-colored visualization scheme.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This script performs some basic hubness visualization for synthetic Gaussian or loaded real-world data.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line parameters, as specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
